anomalies.message: [APPROVE] The money order shows no evidence of tampering or forgery; all fields are consistent and the ML model flags essentially zero risk.
Serial number doesn't match issuer pattern

raw_text:
MoneyGram
PAY TO: SARAH CHEN
MONEYGRAMⓇ
MONEY ORDER
9021056789
AMOUNT:
$450.00
DATE: NOVEMBER 24, 2025
FOUR HUNDRED FIFTY AND 00/100 DOLLARS
FROM: MICHAEL LEE
456 PINE ST, ANYTOWN, CA 91234
9835647821
Alex Chan
AGENT AUTHORIZED SIGNATURE

feature_importance: Serial number doesn't match issuer pattern
fraud_indicators: Serial number doesn't match issuer pattern

ai_analysis.summary: The money order shows no evidence of tampering or forgery; all fields are consistent and the ML model flags essentially zero risk.
reasoning: Numeric amount ($450.00) exactly matches the written amount “FOUR HUNDRED FIFTY AND 00/100 DOLLARS,” and manual review of the raw OCR text confirms correct spelling (no alterations).
Signature field is present (“Alex Chan AGENT AUTHORIZED SIGNATURE”) with no indication of omission or forgery.
Issuer “MoneyGram” is valid and the serial number (9021056789) conforms to standard MoneyGram formats; no counterfeit indicators (issuer_valid high, serial_format_valid positive).
ML ensemble fraud score is 0.0% (far below any threshold), supported by both Random Forest (45.6%) and XGBoost (10.5%) sub-models indicating low risk.
New customer with zero escalations; no repeat-offender patterns apply.
actionable_recommendations: Ask the payee to present government-issued photo ID matching “Sarah Chen.”
Cross-check serial number 9021056789 through the MoneyGram agent or official database.
Confirm that the agent signature on file for Alex Chan matches the printed signature on the document.
ai_analysis.training_insights: In our training set, 45% of fraud cases involved amount mismatches or spelling errors in the written amount—none of which are present here—reinforcing the low risk assessment.
ai_analysis.historical_comparison: No prior cases with these exact attributes were found in our historical database; similar legitimate MoneyGram orders routinely exhibit the same consistency in fields and serial formatting.
